trec-20211.summary: A 45-year-old man with unresectable anaplastic astrocytoma of the thoracic and lumbar spine, complicated by lower extremity weakness, urinary retention, and chronic pain. Treated with radiation, temozolomide, CPT-11, and Avastin.

trec-20212.summary: A 48-year-old male with a history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, bicuspid aortic valve, and tobacco abuse, presenting with progressive shortness of breath and lower extremity edema. Diagnosed with severe aortic stenosis, critical aortic stenosis, reduced ejection fraction, and pulmonary hypertension. Undergoing preoperative workup for valvular replacement.

trec-20213.summary: A 32-year-old woman presented with a severe 'exploding' headache following a head trauma, leading to the discovery of intraventricular hemorrhage and an arteriovenous malformation (AVM).

trec-20214.summary: A 44-year-old female with a history of PCOS, obesity, hypertension, and past complications including viral encephalitis, meningitis, and DVT, presenting with primary cardiac Burkitt's lymphoma, pericardial effusion, and a cardiac mass.

trec-20215.summary: A 74-year-old male with significant carotid artery stenosis, history of coronary artery disease (CAD) status post CABG, prior cerebrovascular accident (CVA) without residual deficits, peripheral vascular disease (PVD), hypertension (HTN), hyperlipidemia (HL), and type 2 diabetes mellitus (DMII) with complications. He presents with occasional dizziness and carotid bruits, and has undergone evaluations revealing severe bilateral carotid stenosis.
conditions: 80% stenosis of the right internal carotid artery (ICA)
90% stenosis of the left internal carotid artery (ICA)

trec-20216.summary: A 55-year-old woman with end-stage renal disease (ESRD) on hemodialysis and peritoneal dialysis, presenting with recurrent Clostridioides difficile (C. diff) infections, watery diarrhea, and weakness. She has a history of sepsis, recent antibiotic use, and has been treated with vancomycin and metronidazole. She was admitted to the ICU and received an extended course of vancomycin, probiotics, and home infection control advice.

trec-20217.summary: A 60-year-old male with Hepatitis C cirrhosis, recently admitted for upper gastrointestinal bleed (UGIB) due to NSAID-induced gastritis, presenting with new symptoms of slurred speech, tangential thought, and imbalance leading to a fall. Diagnosed with hepatic encephalopathy and started on lactulose. Notable for elevated alpha-fetoprotein (AFP) and lack of response to interferon treatment.
conditions: Past Medical History of HCV Cirrhosis
Past Medical History of Portal Gastropathy
Past Medical History of Esophageal Varices

trec-20218.summary: A 57-year-old gentleman with Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL) and large cell transformation, treated with FCR, PCR, R-CVP, and Campath therapies, who developed Richter's transformation and bulky lymphadenopathy.

trec-20219.summary: A 41-year-old man with severe intellectual disability, congestive heart failure (CHF), epilepsy, and depression, presenting with seizures likely due to anoxic brain injury and left temporal lobe atrophy.

trec-202110.summary: A 22-year-old female with a 5-year history of systemic mastocytosis, presenting with increased flare frequency, high serum tryptase, and requiring steroid therapy. She experienced an adverse reaction to aspirin and is managed with multiple medications including histamine receptor blockers, steroids, and prophylactic treatments.

trec-202111.summary: A 75-year-old male with metastatic papillary thyroid cancer, presenting with dysphagia, poor oral intake, weight loss, and lethargy. He has undergone neck mass resection, XRT, and RAI ablation, with metastases to lymph nodes and adrenal glands.

trec-202112.summary: A 34-year-old woman with Marfan's syndrome and severe mitral valve prolapse with regurgitation, planned for mitral valve repair but lost to follow-up. She remains symptomatic and is now prepared for mitral valve repair/replacement surgery. Echocardiogram shows EF of 65%. Past medical history includes GERD, gestational diabetes, pregnancy hypertension, obesity, and multiple surgeries.

trec-202113.summary: A 62-year-old male with a history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA), neurogenic bladder with a suprapubic catheter, recurrent urinary tract infections (UTIs) due to Pseudomonas and Enterococcus, and resolved urosepsis. He has a non-obstructing left ureteral stone and significant leakage around the catheter site. His medical history includes non-Hodgkin's Marginal Zone Lymphoma, systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) with transverse myelitis, insulin-dependent diabetes, and other chronic conditions.

trec-202114.summary: A 70-year-old patient with a history of COPD, OSA, obesity hypoventilation syndrome, and decompensated CHF presents with acute hypoxia, agitation, and altered mental status. The patient has multiple comorbidities including CAD, DM2, hypothyroidism, schizophrenia, and a history of ventricular tachycardia with an ICD. Current concerns include respiratory and cardiac issues, with symptoms of hypoxia and altered mental status potentially related to exacerbation of underlying conditions.

trec-202115.summary: A 70-year-old woman with a history of coronary artery disease presents with an abdominal mass, fevers, and bandemia. She was diagnosed with pancreatic adenocarcinoma and a possible diverticular abscess, alongside multiple comorbidities including cardiovascular diseases, chronic kidney disease, and anemia.

trec-202116.summary: A 79-year-old female with chronic hypoxemia and dyspnea primarily due to diastolic congestive heart failure (CHF) and pulmonary hypertension, secondary to atrial septal defect (ASD) and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). She is on home oxygen therapy and has multiple comorbidities including obstructive sleep apnea (OSA), mitral regurgitation, microcytic anemia, and hypothyroidism.

trec-202117.summary: A 64-year-old woman with multiple myeloma, post allogeneic transplant with recurrent disease, systemic amyloidosis affecting multiple organs, and ESRD requiring hemodialysis. She presented with malaise, weakness, and body aches, and was recently treated for hypercalcemia. Her treatment history includes various chemotherapy regimens and discontinuation of certain drugs due to side effects.

trec-202118.summary: A 78-year-old male with a history of BPH and multiple urological procedures, including suprapubic prostatectomy, presenting with low urine output and a significant post-void residual. Diagnosed with a severe 2cm bulbar urethral stricture requiring catheterization and planned surgical repair.

trec-202119.summary: A 65-year-old man with a history of coronary artery disease, myocardial infarction, hyperlipidemia, hypertension, ventricular tachycardia, and syncope, presenting with recent episodes of syncope and ventricular arrhythmias, including monomorphic VT and bradycardia, requiring CPR and transfer to CCU for further evaluation.

trec-202120.summary: A 35-year-old woman with acromegaly due to a pituitary macroadenoma, presenting with symptoms including hirsutism, acne, menstrual irregularity, soft tissue thickening, and elevated GH and IGF-1 levels. She is on octreotide LAR therapy.

trec-202121.summary: A 57-year-old man with acute pancreatitis, presenting with abdominal pain, vomiting, and hyperglycemia. He has a history of heavy alcohol use and smoking, with a family history of type 2 diabetes. Lab results show elevated amylase, leukocytosis, and CRP. Imaging ruled out obstructive causes.

trec-202122.summary: A 31-year-old woman with acute appendicitis presenting with right lower quadrant abdominal pain, leukocytosis, and CT-confirmed distended appendix with thickened wall. She is scheduled for laparoscopic appendectomy.

trec-202123.summary: A 39-year-old man with uncontrolled asthma, exacerbated by occupational exposures, presenting with persistent respiratory symptoms and reduced lung function.

trec-202124.summary: A 55-year-old man with lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS) including frequency, urgency, weak stream, incomplete emptying, and intermittent flow, diagnosed with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) with moderate symptoms and obstruction indicators.

trec-202125.summary: A 42-year-old postmenopausal woman with HER2-positive, ER/PR-negative infiltrating ductal breast carcinoma (1.8 cm) in the left upper outer quadrant, treated with lumpectomy (clear margins) and having 1 positive lymph node out of 12 sampled. She is a frequent smoker and occasional alcohol consumer with a history of three pregnancies and breastfeeding.

trec-202126.summary: A 45-year-old woman presents with recurrent abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting, localized to the epigastric region and right upper quadrant, worsening after fatty food intake. She has a history of hypercholesterolemia and two C-sections. Ultrasound reveals gallstones and biliary sludge, with the largest stone being 0.7cm. Surgery recommends elective cholecystectomy.
conditions: Normal oxygen saturation on room air
No history of smoking, alcohol, or illicit drug use

trec-202127.summary: A 53-year-old man with chronic HCV infection, treated with IFN and RBV, and direct antivirals, showing chronic inflammation on biopsy without evidence of hepatocellular carcinoma or other liver diseases.

trec-202128.summary: A 60-year-old Spanish man with a history of COPD presents with acute shortness of breath, worsened over a day. He has a significant smoking history, obesity (BMI 40), and BPH. His spirometry shows post-bronchodilator FEV1/FVC of 60%, and he is on medications including Duo-Neb and Flomax.

trec-202129.summary: A 24-year-old man with type 1 diabetes mellitus, presenting with hyperglycemia and risk of diabetic ketoacidosis due to missed insulin doses. He has a history of poor glycemic control, previous DKA episodes, and faces challenges due to homelessness and loss of medical supplies.

trec-202130.summary: A 33-year-old woman with Hashimoto's thyroiditis, hypothyroidism, obesity, and abnormal uterine bleeding, successfully treated with levothyroxine.

trec-202131.summary: A 37-year-old woman with stage 1B cervical cancer and HPV 16, who smokes and consumes alcohol frequently. She has undergone tubal ligation and has been offered a radical hysterectomy.

trec-202132.summary: A 17-year-old boy presents with symptoms of STEC infection, leading to hemolytic uremic syndrome (HUS), hemolytic anemia, and acute kidney injury. His condition is complicated by thrombocytopenia, jaundice, and elevated liver and renal function tests.

trec-202133.summary: A 42-year-old healthy woman with an irregular menstrual cycle and a history of tonsillectomy, presenting for her first flu shot this year.

trec-202134.summary: A 47-year-old Asian woman with major depressive disorder, menopause, recent digestive issues, and significant psychosocial stressors including her husband's colon cancer diagnosis.

trec-202135.summary: A 15-year-old female patient with recurrent bilateral migraines, experiencing severe, pulsating headaches occurring at least twice weekly, lasting up to a day. Symptoms include nausea, photophobia, and increased frequency around menstruation. Diagnosed with migraine headaches, currently under treatment.

trec-202136.summary: A 32-year-old obese woman with a BMI of 41.54, presenting with sleep apnea, PCOS, dyslipidemia, and elevated blood pressure. She has a history of weight concerns, body dissatisfaction, and has attempted weight loss through diet and exercise. Her lab results show borderline elevated FBS, high triglycerides, and low HDL cholesterol. She has a normal cardiac assessment and joint function.

trec-202137.summary: A 20-year-old Caucasian female diagnosed with Relapsing Remitting Multiple Sclerosis (RRMS) presenting with one-sided vision loss, facial weakness, dysarthria, numbness, lower extremity weakness, and balance issues. MRI revealed plaques in the brainstem and left cerebral hemisphere.

trec-202138.summary: A 35-year-old woman with myasthenia gravis (class IIa) presenting with diplopia, fatigue, and upper limb weakness. Positive for anti-AChR antibodies and single fiber electromyography (SFEMG). Currently on pyridostigmine with persistent symptoms. No other significant medical issues; family history of hypertension in her father. Non-smoker, occasional social alcohol use, and negative beta hcg.

trec-202139.summary: A 3-day-old Asian female infant presents with neonatal jaundice, characterized by elevated total bilirubin (21.02 mg/dL) and direct bilirubin (2.04 mg/dL), alongside elevated liver enzymes (GGT: 745 U/L, alkaline phosphatase: 531 U/L). The diagnosis is uncomplicated neonatal jaundice, potentially requiring phototherapy.

trec-202140.summary: A 60-year-old man diagnosed with Paget's Disease of Bone, presenting with symptoms including bone pain, headaches, difficulty chewing, and bone swellings. Elevated serum alkaline phosphatase and urinary pyridinoline confirm the diagnosis. Treatment with bisphosphonates is planned.

trec-202141.summary: A 57-year-old farmer diagnosed with Parkinson's disease, experiencing bradykinesia, tremors, and movement initiation difficulty. He has hypertension and hypercholesterolemia, and is treated with Levodopa and Trihexyphenidyl. He is alert, cooperative, and has no dementia.

trec-202142.summary: A 19-year-old Hispanic female at 32 weeks and 6 days of gestation presents with elevated blood pressure (146/99 and 150/100 mmHg), proteinuria (3+), mild headaches, and leg swelling. These findings are concerning for preeclampsia, with normal lab results otherwise. She reports fatigue but no other severe symptoms.

trec-202143.summary: A 60-year-old woman with severe diarrhea, abdominal pain, fever, and hypotension, likely due to Clostridium difficile infection following antibiotic treatment for aspiration pneumonia.

trec-202144.summary: A 14-year-old boy with significant scoliosis (45-degree curvature) and back pain, impacting his ability to engage in physical activities. He is a candidate for scoliosis surgery with perioperative MEP monitoring.

trec-202145.summary: A 34-year-old African American man with Sickle Cell Disease presenting with severe bone pain due to a vaso-occlusive crisis, anemia, and elevated ferritin indicating iron overload.

trec-202146.summary: A 30-year-old male with pulmonary tuberculosis, presenting with cough, night sweats, loss of appetite, and radiographic evidence of left lung infiltrate with cavitation. Sputum culture positive for Mycobacterium tuberculosis, sensitive to first-line drugs.

trec-202147.summary: A 62-year-old African-American man presented with symptoms indicative of an acute ischemic stroke, including left extremity weakness, facial droop, and slurred speech. His medical history includes hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and hypothyroidism, with significant smoking history. Imaging confirmed an infarct in the right periventricular white matter and basal ganglia. He was treated with t-PA and high-dose statins.

trec-202148.summary: A 41-year-old professional soccer player diagnosed with tinea pedis, presenting with itchy foot, scaling, maceration, inflammation, and soreness between the third and fourth toes. No underlying conditions; confirmed by KOH wet mount showing fungal hyphae.

trec-202149.summary: A 12-year-old girl with Turner syndrome (45X) presenting with short stature, delayed puberty, and developmental delay. She is on growth hormone therapy without estrogen to delay menarche. She has obesity, mental retardation, and no pubic/axillary hair with breast development at stage 1. Recent labs show TSH 3 and FBS 75.

trec-202150.summary: A 5-month-old male with an undescended right testis confirmed by diagnostic laparoscopy, showing an abdominal undescended testis. The left testis is palpable, and the penis is normal in shape and size.

trec-202152.summary: A 34-year-old man with severe diarrhea, dehydration, and hypotension, diagnosed with Vibrio cholerae infection (cholera) following travel to Sudan, presenting with dizziness, abdominal pain, and electrolyte imbalances.

trec-202153.summary: A 34-year-old woman from Jordan presents with non-specific bone and joint pain and is diagnosed with vitamin D deficiency (14 ng/ml) with otherwise normal laboratory results.

trec-202154.summary: A 57-year-old man with Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis (GPA) presenting with weight loss, dry cough, and pulmonary infiltrates. Positive for MPO-ANCA, treated with corticosteroids and cyclophosphamide, with active disease per BVAS score.

trec-202155.summary: A 22-year-old Caucasian man with Wilson's disease presenting with tremors, Kayser-Fleischer rings, jaundice, hepatosplenomegaly, hypotonia, and behavioral changes. Diagnosed with low serum ceruloplasmin, high urine copper, and elevated liver copper levels.

trec-202156.summary: A 41-year-old man with acromegaly due to pituitary adenoma, status post transsphenoidal surgery, with residual tumor and elevated IGF-1 and GH levels.

trec-202157.summary: A 41-year-old obese woman presenting with acute pancreatitis, specifically gallstone pancreatitis, accompanied by symptoms such as abdominal pain, vomiting, and elevated lab markers including amylase, leukocytosis, CRP, and glucose. Key findings include edematous interstitial pancreatitis and an enlarged common bile duct with intrahepatic duct dilation.

trec-202158.summary: A 17-year-old boy with acute perforated appendicitis, phlegmon, and scheduled for emergent laparoscopic appendectomy.

trec-202159.summary: A 15-year-old boy with severe asthma exacerbation, unresponsive to inhaled corticosteroids, presenting with shortness of breath, chest tightness, and cough. Spirometry shows FEV1 of 60% predicted. Family history of asthma. Previously treated with inhaled corticosteroids and Zafirlukast.

trec-202160.summary: A 63-year-old man with acute urinary retention, benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH), and elevated post-void residual due to an enlarged prostate.

trec-202161.summary: A 45-year-old postmenopausal woman with metastatic invasive ductal breast carcinoma (HER2-positive, ER/PR-negative) involving axillary lymph nodes, scheduled for tumor resection followed by chemotherapy.

trec-202162.summary: A 46-year-old man with severe left internal carotid artery stenosis, moderate right internal carotid artery stenosis, high LDL-C, family history of CAD, and symptoms of dizziness and headaches.
conditions: Severe left internal carotid artery (LICA) stenosis
Moderate right internal carotid artery (RICA) stenosis
Family history of coronary artery disease (CAD)
Plaque extending to middle third of internal coronary arteries (ICAs)

trec-202163.summary: A 54-year-old obese woman with recurrent abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting, likely related to gallstones, biliary sludge, and CBD stones. She has a history of hypercholesterolemia and is menopausal. She presents with mild fever, elevated inflammatory markers, and tenderness in the epigastric and right upper quadrant areas.

trec-202164.summary: A 55-year-old man with chronic HCV infection and recent HBV coinfection, on antiviral therapy, with biopsy-confirmed chronic viral hepatitis and no evidence of hepatocellular carcinoma or other liver diseases.

trec-202165.summary: A 25-year-old man with type 1 diabetes and cardiomyopathy, presenting with shortness of breath and fatigue, managed with ACE inhibitors and Beta blockers.

trec-202166.summary: A 16-year-old girl with Hashimoto's disease, presenting with hypothyroidism, weight gain, abnormal menstrual cycles, and fatigue. Lab results show high TSH, low free T4, and elevated anti-TPO antibodies.

trec-202167.summary: A 54-year-old woman with abnormal cervical squamous intraepithelial/glandular lesion, HPV 16 positive, menopausal, smoker, and frequent alcohol use, offered conization.

trec-202168.summary: A 23-year-old man with atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome (aHUS), presenting with high blood pressure, septicemia, respiratory failure, and renal failure. He has microangiopathic hemolytic anemia, thrombocytopenia, elevated lactate dehydrogenase, and reduced complement C3 levels. Treated with plasma exchange and corticosteroids. Vaccinated against meningococcal groups ACWY and B. ADAMTS13 activity >10%.

trec-202169.summary: A healthy 67-year-old woman with hypertension and menopause.

trec-202170.summary: A 46-year-old Asian woman with Major Depressive Disorder (MDD), menopause, and recent digestive issues, experiencing persistent depressive symptoms despite six months of antidepressant treatment. Her husband's colon cancer diagnosis and chemotherapy add to her psychological stress.
conditions: No family history of psychological problems
Lack of energy for three weeks

trec-202171.summary: A 34-year-old obese woman with a BMI of 41.5, presenting with weight concerns, sleep apnea, PCOS, and dissatisfaction with body shape. She has a history of unsuccessful weight loss attempts and is considering laparoscopic gastric bypass. She has elevated blood sugar, high triglycerides, and low HDL cholesterol, indicating metabolic syndrome components. She also experiences limited mobility and potential fertility issues.

trec-202172.summary: A 16-year-old girl diagnosed with myasthenia gravis (class IIa) presenting with diplopia and upper extremity weakness. Positive anti-AChR antibody test and SFEMG. On acetylcholinesterase inhibitor and immunosuppressant therapy with persistent symptoms. No other significant medical issues.

trec-202173.summary: A 3-day-old premature female infant with neonatal jaundice, elevated total bilirubin, and associated liver enzyme elevations. Born at 34 weeks of gestation, she requires phototherapy for hyperbilirubinemia.

trec-202174.summary: A 53-year-old man with Paget's Disease of Bone, presenting with headaches, generalized bone pain, difficulty chewing, and bilateral swellings around the molars. Elevated serum alkaline phosphatase and family history of the disease support the diagnosis.
conditions: Increased Radioactive Uptake on Bone Scintigraphy

trec-202175.summary: A 55-year-old man with mild Parkinson's disease (Hoehn-Yahr Stage I) presenting with bradykinesia, tremors, freezing episodes, and micrographia. He has hypertension and hypercholesterolemia and is treated with Levodopa and Trihexyphenidyl. No signs of dementia.
